seedGroups.name: Shattering
seedGroups.description: Shattering seeds can be tough to visually judge for ripeness. Use a *gentle* touch test to see if the seeds easily loosen.

species.description: Shattering. This common buttercup is found in woodlands, wet to dry. Flowers are tiny, about ¼” across, with petals smaller than the green center disc. Lower basal leaves are kidney-shaped (most buttercups have lobed leaves). Collect when seeds are easily loosened.
